description: Behavioral tests for Media Planning Agent v5.3+ validating response quality, source transparency, and step discipline

testCases.name: Opening Warmth
testCases.utterance: Help me create a media plan for a new product launch.
testCases.expectedBehavior: Agent should provide warm confident opening that names 10 focus areas (Outcomes, Economics, Audience, Geography, Budget, Value Proposition, Channels, Measurement, Testing, Risks) and asks a single Step 1 question about objectives. Should NOT feel like a syllabus or list multiple questions.
testCases.passCriteria: Warm tone, mentions focus areas, asks ONE question only

testCases.name: CAC Calculation
testCases.utterance: We have $100,000 budget and want to acquire 2,000 customers.
testCases.expectedBehavior: Agent should calculate $50 CAC, compare to benchmarks, cite source (KB/web/estimate), and characterize as aggressive/typical/conservative. Should NOT just ask another question without doing the math.
testCases.passCriteria: Calculates $50 CAC, cites source, provides feasibility assessment

testCases.name: Source Transparency
testCases.utterance: What CPM should I expect for LinkedIn advertising?
testCases.expectedBehavior: Agent should cite source: either 'I searched our knowledge base and found...' or 'Based on web search...' or 'I don't have a citable benchmark, but my estimate is...'. Should NOT present numbers without attribution.
testCases.passCriteria: Explicitly states source of benchmark data

testCases.name: No Redundant Questions
testCases.utterance: Our goal is to increase brand awareness among millennials aged 25-34 in urban areas.
testCases.expectedBehavior: Agent should acknowledge the rich detail provided and ask ONE follow-up about a gap (budget, timeline, geography specifics). Should NOT ask multiple questions or repeat back what was just said.
testCases.passCriteria: Acknowledges input, asks single focused follow-up

testCases.name: Step Boundary
testCases.utterance: Should we use TikTok or Instagram for our campaign?
testCases.expectedBehavior: Agent should acknowledge channel interest but redirect to Step 1 objectives first: 'Channel selection comes in Step 7. First, let's establish your business objectives so we can evaluate channels against your goals.' Should NOT dive into channel comparison.
testCases.passCriteria: Redirects to Step 1, explains why channels come later

testCases.name: Aggressive Target Framing
testCases.utterance: We want to achieve 10x ROAS on our first campaign with a $50K budget.
testCases.expectedBehavior: Agent should acknowledge the ambition, note that 10x ROAS is aggressive (typical is 2-4x), and frame a path: 'That's an ambitious target. Typical ROAS ranges 2-4x. To pursue 10x, we'll need very precise targeting and likely a proven offer. What's your product category?' Should NOT dismiss or just validate without context.
testCases.passCriteria: Frames as aggressive, provides typical range, offers path forward

testCases.name: Response Conciseness
testCases.utterance: Yes, our primary goal is lead generation.
testCases.expectedBehavior: Agent should give brief acknowledgment (1-2 sentences max) and move forward with next question or insight. Should NOT repeat back what user said in elaborate detail or give a lengthy explanation of lead generation.
testCases.passCriteria: Response under 3 sentences, moves conversation forward

testCases.name: Acronym Definition
testCases.utterance: What's a good CAC for SaaS companies?
testCases.expectedBehavior: Agent should define acronyms on first use: 'Customer Acquisition Cost (CAC) for Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) companies typically ranges...' Should NOT assume user knows all acronyms even if they used one.
testCases.passCriteria: Defines CAC and SaaS on first use

testCases.name: Proactive Analysis
testCases.utterance: We have $500K annual budget, targeting 100K website visitors, in the B2B software space.
testCases.expectedBehavior: Agent should immediately calculate: '$500K / 100K = $5 cost per visitor' and assess feasibility against B2B benchmarks. Should NOT just ask another clarifying question when math is possible.
testCases.passCriteria: Calculates $5 CPV, compares to B2B benchmarks

testCases.name: No Creative Discussion
testCases.utterance: What kind of creative messaging should we use?
testCases.expectedBehavior: Agent should redirect: 'Creative strategy is important but comes after we establish objectives, audience, and channels. Let's first understand your business goals.' Should NOT discuss creative messaging in Step 1.
testCases.passCriteria: Redirects to objectives, does not discuss creative

multiTurnTests.name: Full Step 1 Flow
multiTurnTests.description: Tests complete Step 1 conversation from greeting to validation

turns.utterance: Hi, I need help with media planning.
turns.expectedBehavior: Warm greeting, introduces 10-step process, asks about objectives

turns.utterance: We want to generate 500 qualified leads for our new B2B software product.
turns.expectedBehavior: Acknowledges lead gen goal, may ask about budget or timeline
Calculates $400 cost per lead, assesses against B2B benchmarks, cites source
Provides context on B2B CPL ranges, characterizes $400 as typical/aggressive/conservative

dimensions.name: Source Transparency
dimensions.criteria: Agent cites KB, web, or labels estimates clearly

dimensions.name: Response Efficiency
dimensions.criteria: Responses are concise, no redundant repetition

dimensions.name: Analytical Proactivity
dimensions.criteria: Agent calculates when data allows, doesn't just ask more questions

dimensions.name: Tone Quality
dimensions.criteria: Warm, professional, not robotic or overly formal
